Both are located in the eastern China. Lvsi HarborÂ  a coast fishing harbor, is located in the north shore of Yangtz River in eastern Jiangsu province. I was burn there 55 years ago and left there when I was 15 years old. The Lvsian speaks very different dialect of the Chinese language. I bet you won't understand even a complete sentence if you are not from there. It is pretty unique somehow in the south-eastern Jiangsu province where the Wu dialect dominates. An ancient legend says that the eight immortals cross the East China Sea really happened here. https://youtu.be/Rlu-wPwDW-o My journey of visiting my mom started from the Pudong international airport on April 8th after 14 hours flight from Toronto, Canada. The recently built giganticÂ  bridge across the Yangtz River dramatically short the distance between Shanghai and Lvsi. We used to take both bus and ship to travel to Shanghai which takes 12 hours but now only two hours we can get to the downtown Shanghai. Thank God we have the best government in this worldÂ  today! My brother picked me up at the airport and drove me home. https://youtu.be/cj45MRCacbU The next morning (April 9th) I visited neighbors. https://youtu.be/j1dcwzFtCKM https://youtu.be/7IFP9gumC48 My mom is 80 years old and she still rides her bicycle to go to supermarkets in the town or visit her friends. https://youtu.be/NoZurftegno On April 10th I visited my high school classmates in the town. I have never seen them since May 1978. https://youtu.be/Fvn-pMPa-LY On April 20 my sister drove me to visit the new Lvsi harbor and mom joined us. https://youtu.be/-nLtCMK9e9Q After years of development organized by the local government Lvsi Harbor has expanded land miles deep into the Yellow Sea. The new harbor is located on the west side of the old harbor. Lots of new buildings can be seen and are ready for business. https://youtu.be/omK4Ett5Ets On April 11th I took a bus to Hangzhou with mom. The next morning we started our Hangzhou tour at the famous West Lake. Mom was so happy to walk on the bank of the lake. https://youtu.be/rJ-foUAqc10 On April 13th we left Hangzhou for Nanjing by high speed train. The journey took only one and half hours. https://youtu.be/GiqLN-gA2sU We visited the presidential palace in Nanjing. https://youtu.be/kLsrqtMi4JM In the morning of April 15th, I found I was in the Gulou square of Nanjing. https://youtu.be/mOuheoRmpQk I choose the high speed train toÂ Nantong on April 15th. https://youtu.be/pfz6FX7DYjw The train arrived in Nantong after two and half hours.
